required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Brain Activity by Magnetoencephalography for Children
clinical_study.official_title: The Brain Network Activity of Functional Tasks Performance by Magnetoencephalography for Children

brief_summary.textblock: Investigate the differences in activation of brain networks during performing functional tasks for children with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder with developmental delays and typical development

detailed_description.textblock:
A total of 12 children with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder with developmental delays and12 children with typical development will be enrolled.
The following evaluations will be evaluated by the investigator who is blinded to the group's classification.
Working task-related functions, such as Beery-Buktenica Visual-Motor Integration, Sensory Profile, the Chinese version of Swanson, Nolan and Pelham version IV, and Chinese version of Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children-IV)
Non-working memory-related functions, such as Pediatric Outcome Data Collection Instrument (PODCI), Child Health Questionnaire- Parent Form (CHQ-PF 28), Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory (PedsQL), and physical function (10 meters normal and fast walking, stair ascent, stair descent, and 5 times chair rising and timed up and go test)
All participants will be investigated by magnetoencephalography and eye-tracking system to identify the difference of brain network activation during resting and performing tasks and between-group differences.
Brain magnetic resonance image study will be performed for matching of brain localization.

primary_outcome.time_frame: measure simultaneous brain activity by different types of music through study completion, up to 6 minutes
primary_outcome.description: magnetoencephalography by different types of music

primary_outcome.time_frame: measure simultaneous brain activity by different types of videos through study completion, up to 10.5 minutes
primary_outcome.description: magnetoencephalography by different types of videos

primary_outcome.time_frame: measure simultaneous brain activity by different types of interactive cognitive stimulation through study completion, up to 5 minutes
primary_outcome.description: magnetoencephalography by different types of interactive cognitive stimulation

other_outcome.description: assess sensory integration,15 to 85, higher scores mean a better outcome
assess the symptoms of attention deficit hyperactivity disorders, 0-78, higher scores mean a worse outcome
assess the intelligence, 40-160, higher scores mean a better outcome
assess the functional performance, 0-100, higher scores mean a better outcome
assess the family impact, 0-100, higher scores mean a better outcome
assess the health-related quality of life, 0-100, higher scores mean a better outcome
assess normal and fastest walking speed
assess ascent and descent stairs time
assess time for stand up from a chair, go around for 3 meters, and sit down to chair

arm_group.arm_group_label: Children with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder with developmental delays
arm_group.description: Children with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder with developmental delays

intervention.description: The brain network activity under different conditions will be evaluated by magnetoencephalography, including resting, listen to different types of music, watch different types of videos, and interacting with cognitive stimulation conditions.
intervention.arm_group_label: Children with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder with developmental delays

study_pop.textblock: Children diagnosed with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder with developmental delays, aged 4 to 10; and age-sex matched children with typical development

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder with development delays
- intelligence quotient 70 or greater
Exclusion Criteria:
- age less than 4 or greater than 10 of children
- intelligence quotient less than 70

overall_official.affiliation: Shin Kong Wu Ho-Su Memorial Hospital

facility.name: Shin Kong Wu Ho-Su Memorial Hospital
